title: Park with Citi Handlowy
summary: Warsaw - Beginning Monday, March 26, residents of Warsaw who decide to open a CitiOne account may benefit from the "Park with Citi Handlowy" promotion. As part of the promotion they will get the Warsaw City Debit Card topped up with the amount of PLN 50 to be used at parking meters of Warsaw Non-Guarded Parking Toll Zone.
tag-2: Warsaw – Beginning Monday, March 26, residents of Warsaw who decide to open a CitiOne account may benefit from the "Park with Citi Handlowy" promotion. As part of the promotion they will get the Warsaw City Debit Card topped up with the amount of PLN 50 to be used at parking meters of Warsaw Non-Guarded Parking Toll Zone.
tag-3: "While expanding the functionalities of our City Debit Card, we always take into account real needs of customers," says Tomasz Daniun, retail customer segment development director. "Many Warsaw residents who drive their cars on a daily basis have found themselves in a situation where they have no change to pay a parking fee through a parking meter. The City Debit Card is an ideal solution for them. Given the opportunity to make non-cash payments at parking meters, a shortage of coins is no longer a problem."
tag-4: The "Park with Citi Handlowy" promotion allows the bank customers to use all functionalities of Warsaw City Debit Card, such as non-cash payments at shops, the Internet, discounts as part of Payment Card Discount Program, the biggest program in Poland, cheaper long-term public transport tickets in Warsaw, and to benefit from advantages offered by CitiOne account to its users. Those advantages include free debit card, free withdrawals from all ATMs in Poland and all around the world and the possibility to be exempted from the account maintenance fee. Citi One account is an offer for those who will declare regular payments of PLN 5,000 to the account or will maintain an average balance at the level of PLN 15,000.
tag-5: Citi Handlowy is the first bank in Poland which has enabled its customers to combine their payment card with city card. Since the implementation of the first City Payment Card in Warsaw, the Bank has already issued over 27 thousand cards, which are currently used not only by residents of Warsaw but also by inhabitants of Tricity, Wroclaw and, since December last year, of Lódz.
tag-6: "Park with Citi Handlowy" promotion lasts from March 26 to June 30 or until the pool of City Debit Cards is exhausted.
tag-7: For Terms and Conditions of the promotion and detailed information about the offer of Citibank City Payment Card please visit www.citihandlowy.pl.
tag-8: Also watch the film about Citibank Urban Debit Card in Wroclaw. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wnmdmo60BKw
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
tag-10: Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com | Twitter: @Citi | YouTube: www.youtube.com/citi | Blog: http://new.citi.com | Facebook: www.facebook.com/citi | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/citi
tag-11: Citi Handlowy  Citi Handlowy is one of the major financial institutions in Poland and offers, under the Citi Handlowy brand, a broad range of state-of-the-art products in corporate, investment and consumer banking. Through its modern distribution channels and a network of over 149 branches, Bank Handlowy services 20,000 corporate customers and 965,000 individual ones. The Bank's group includes Dom Maklerski Banku Handlowego (brokerage house) and Handlowy Leasing. Being a member of Citi enables the customers of Bank Handlowy access to financial services provided in over 100 countries. Further information is available at www.citihandlowy.pl.
